Need help reading this?

SVM

src/svm.js

Simplified version of the Sequential Minimal Optimization algorithm for training support vector machines

new SVM(options: {Object})
Parameters
options ({Object}) SVM options
Name Description
options.C [Number] (default 1) regularization parameter
options.tol [Number] (default 1e-4) numerical tolerance
options.alphaTol [Number] (default 1e-6) alpha tolerance, threshold to decide support vectors
options.maxPasses [Number] (default 10) max number of times to iterate over alphas without changing
options.maxIterations [Number] (default 10000) max number of iterations
options.kernel [String] (default linear) the kind of kernel. List of kernels
options.random [Function] (default Math.random) custom random number generator
Static Members
▸ load(model)

Create a SVM instance from a saved model

load(model: Object): SVM
Parameters
model (Object) Object such as returned by a trained SVM instance with toJSON
Returns
SVM: Instance of svm classifier
Instance Members
▸ train(features, labels)

Train the SVM model

train(features: Array<Array<number>>, labels: Array<number>)
Parameters
features (Array<Array<number>>) training data features
labels (Array<number>) training data labels in the domain {1,-1}
▸ predict(features)

Predict the classification outcome of a trained svm given one or several observations' features.

predict(features: Array): (Array<Number> | Number)
Parameters
features (Array) The observation(s)' features
Returns
(Array<Number> | Number): An array of {-1, 1} if several observations are given or a number if one observation is given
▸ margin(features)

Returns the margin of one or several observations given its features

margin(features: (Array<Array<Number>> | Array<Number>)): (Number | Array)
Parameters
features ((Array<Array<Number>> | Array<Number>)) Features from on or several observations.
Returns
(Number | Array): The computed margin. Is an Array if several observations' features given, or a Number if only one observation's features given
▸ supportVectors()

Get support vectors indexes of the trained classifier. WARINNG: this method does not work for svm instances created from load if linear kernel

supportVectors(): Array<Number>
Returns
Array<Number>: The indices in the training vector of the support vectors
▸ toJSON()

Export the minimal object that enables to reload the model

toJSON(): Object
Returns
Object: Model object that can be reused with load
